intro: Cynanchum heterophyllum, commonly known as the Chinese milkweed or the blue milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, and its latex contains milky sap. Cynanchum heterophyllum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. It has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
